### Base de dados a ser analisada
```{r}

df <- read.csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/JessicaHemily/COMP_1/main/AdultPopulationSurvey.csv', 
				  header = TRUE,
				  sep = ',')

head(df)
```

### 1. Compreensão dos dados

```{r}
glimpse(df)
summary(df)
```

### Outliers

```{r fig.align='center', fig.height=15, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
par(mfrow = c(4,4))
for (coluna in c(3:15)) {
  boxplot(df[coluna])
}
```

Há poucos outliers na base de dados

### NAs na base?

```{r}

df_na <- df[!complete.cases(df),]
head(df_na)   

```
```{r}
linhas_na <- nrow(df_na)
linhas_df <- nrow(df)
linhas_na

cat("A base de dados possui",linhas_df, "observacoes e",linhas_na, "linhas contendo ao menos um NA")
```
### Identificar as variáveis que possuem NAs

```{r}

cbind(colSums(is.na(df)))

```

### Modelo

```{r}

modelo <- lm(High.Job.Creation.Expectation ~ Perceived.opportunities + Perceived.capabilities + Fear.of.failure.rate.. + Entrepreneurial.intentions + Total.early.stage.Entrepreneurial.Activity..TEA. + Established.Business.Ownership + Entrepreneurial.Employee.Activity + Motivational.Index + Female.Male.TEA + Female.Male.Opportunity.Driven.TEA + Innovation + Business.Services.Sector + High.Status.to.Successful.Entrepreneurs + Entrepreneurship.as.a.Good.Career.Choice, data = df)
  
```
```{r fig.align='center', fig.height=15, fig.width=15, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
par(mfrow = c(2,2))
plot(modelo)

```
